intro: Hydrophyllum fendleri var. fendleri, commonly known as desert paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, which helps reduce water loss. The species is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various purposes.
